html: As Jehovah rewards evil for evil, so the “catastrophe” or “evil” (ra‘a) the Harlot Babylon causes in people’s lives comes back on herself. Although in her profligacy she could bribe her way out of trouble, she doesn’t succeed this time. Her flaws are incurable and her oppression of Zion has reached saturation point (Jeremiah 51:24-25). “Disaster” and “sudden ruin” beyond all imagining are the order of the day: “She has fallen; Babylon has fallen. All her idol gods he has razed to the ground” (Isaiah 21:9); “At evening time shall be the catastrophe, and before morning they shall be no more” (Isaiah 17:14).
